classes.name: Client
classes.description: The starting point for making a Discord Bot.

params.name: options
params.description: Options for the client

methods.name: login
methods.description:
Logs the client in. If successful, resolves with the account's token. <warn>If you're making a bot, it's
much better to use a bot account rather than a user account.
Bot accounts have higher rate limits and have access to some features user accounts don't have. User bots
that are making a lot of API requests can even be banned.</warn>

params.name: tokenOrEmail
params.description:
The token or email used for the account. If it is an email, a password _must_ be
provided.

params.name: password
params.description: The password for the account, only needed if an email was provided.

methods.name: destroy
methods.description: Destroys the client and logs out.

methods.name: syncGuilds
methods.description:
This shouldn't really be necessary to most developers as it is automatically invoked every 30 seconds, however
if you wish to force a sync of Guild data, you can use this. Only applicable to user accounts.

params.name: guilds
params.description: An array of guilds to sync

methods.name: fetchUser
methods.description:
Caches a user, or obtains it from the cache if it's already cached.
If the user isn't already cached, it will only be obtainable by OAuth bot accounts.

params.name: id
params.description: The ID of the user to obtain

properties.description: A Collection of the Client's stored users

properties.name: guilds

properties.name: channels
properties.description: A Collection of the Client's stored channels

properties.name: token
properties.description: The authorization token for the logged in user/bot.

properties.name: user
properties.description: The ClientUser representing the logged in Client

properties.name: email

properties.name: voiceConnections

properties.description: The uptime for the logged in Client.

properties.name: emojis
properties.description: The emojis that the client can use. Mapped by emoji ID.

properties.name: status
properties.description: The status for the logged in Client.

classes.name: StreamDispatcher

methods.name: end
methods.description: Stops the current stream permanently and emits an `end` event.

methods.name: setVolume
methods.description: Sets the volume relative to the input stream - i.e. 1 is normal, 0.5 is half, 2 is double.

params.name: volume
params.description: The volume that you want to set

methods.name: setVolumeDecibels
methods.description: Set the volume in decibels

params.name: db
params.description: The decibels

methods.name: setVolumeLogarithmic
methods.description: Set the volume so that a perceived value of 0.5 is half the perceived volume etc.

params.name: value
params.description: The value for the volume

methods.name: pause
methods.description: Stops sending voice packets to the voice connection (stream may still progress however)

methods.name: resume
methods.description: Resumes sending voice packets to the voice connection (may be further on in the stream than when paused)

properties.name: volume
properties.description: The volume of the stream, relative to the stream's input volume

events.name: speaking
events.description: Emitted when the dispatcher starts/stops speaking

params.name: value
params.description: Whether or not the dispatcher is speaking

events.name: end
events.description: Emitted once the stream has ended. Attach a `once` listener to this.

events.name: error
events.description: Emitted once the stream has encountered an error. Attach a `once` listener to this. Also emits `end`.

params.name: err
params.description: The encountered error

events.name: debug
events.description: Emitted when the stream wants to give debug information.

params.name: information
params.description: The debug information

classes.name: VoiceReceiver

methods.name: createOpusStream
methods.description:
Creates a readable stream for a user that provides opus data while the user is speaking. When the user
stops speaking, the stream is destroyed.

params.name: user
params.description: The user to create the stream for

methods.name: createPCMStream
methods.description:
Creates a readable stream for a user that provides PCM data while the user is speaking. When the user
stops speaking, the stream is destroyed. The stream is 16-bit signed stereo PCM at 48KHz.

params.name: user
params.description: The user to create the stream for

properties.name: connection
properties.description: The VoiceConnection that instantiated this

events.name: warn
events.description: Emitted whenever a voice packet cannot be decrypted

params.name: message
params.description: The warning message

events.name: opus
events.description: Emitted whenever voice data is received from the voice connection. This is _always_ emitted (unlike PCM).

params.name: user
params.description: The user that is sending the buffer (is speaking)

params.name: buffer
params.description: The opus buffer

events.name: pcm
events.description:
Emits decoded voice data when it's received. For performance reasons, the decoding will only
happen if there is at least one `pcm` listener on this receiver.

params.name: user
params.description: The user that is sending the buffer (is speaking)

params.name: buffer
params.description: The decoded buffer

params.description: The ID of this shard

properties.name: process

classes.name: ShardingManager
classes.description:
This is a utility class that can be used to help you spawn shards of your Client. Each shard is completely separate
from the other. The Shard Manager takes a path to a file and spawns it under the specified amount of shards safely.
<warn>The Sharding Manager is still experimental</warn>

params.name: file
params.description: Path to your shard script file

params.name: totalShards
params.description: Number of shards to default to spawning

methods.name: createShard
methods.description: Spawns a single shard.

methods.name: spawn
methods.description: Spawns multiple shards.

params.name: amount
params.description: The number of shards to spawn

properties.name: file
properties.description: Path to the shard script file

properties.name: totalShards
properties.description: The amount of shards that this manager is going to spawn

properties.name: shards
properties.description: A collection of shards that this manager has spawned

classes.name: Channel
classes.description: Represents any Channel on Discord

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Deletes the channel
examples:
// delete the channel
channel.delete()
 .then() // success
 .catch(console.log); // log error

properties.name: client
properties.description: The client that instantiated the Channel

properties.name: type
properties.description:
The type of the channel, either:
* `dm` - a DM channel
* `group` - a Group DM channel
* `text` - a guild text channel
* `voice` - a guild voice channel

properties.name: id
properties.description: The unique ID of the channel

properties.name: creationDate
properties.description: The time the channel was created

classes.name: ClientUser
classes.description: Represents the logged in client's Discord User

methods.name: setUsername
methods.description:
Set the username of the logged in Client.
<info>Changing usernames in Discord is heavily rate limited, with only 2 requests
every hour. Use this sparingly!</info>

params.name: username
params.description: The new username

methods.name: setEmail
methods.description:
If this user is a "self bot" or logged in using a normal user's details (which should be avoided), you can set the
email here.

params.name: email
params.description: The new email

methods.name: setPassword
methods.description:
If this user is a "self bot" or logged in using a normal user's details (which should be avoided), you can set the
password here.

params.name: password
params.description: The new password

methods.name: setAvatar
methods.description: Set the avatar of the logged in Client.

params.name: avatar
params.description: The new avatar

methods.name: setStatus
methods.description: Set the status and playing game of the logged in client.

params.name: status
params.description: The status, can be `online` or `idle`

params.name: game
params.description: The game that is being played

params.name: url
params.description:
If you want to display as streaming, set this as the URL to the stream (must be a
twitch.tv URl)

methods.name: deleteDM
methods.description: Deletes a DM Channel (if one exists) between the Client and the User. Resolves with the Channel if successful.

methods.name: equals
methods.description:
Checks if the user is equal to another. It compares username, ID, discriminator, status and the game being played.
It is recommended to compare equality by using `user.id === user2.id` unless you want to compare all properties.

params.name: user
params.description: The user to compare

methods.name: toString
methods.description: When concatenated with a string, this automatically concatenates the User's mention instead of the User object.
examples:
// logs: Hello from <@123456789>!
console.log(`Hello from ${user}!`);

methods.name: sendMessage
methods.description: Send a message to this channel

params.description: The content to send

params.name: options
params.description: The options to provide

methods.name: sendTTSMessage
methods.description: Send a text-to-speech message to this channel

params.name: content
params.description: The content to send

params.name: options
params.description: The options to provide

methods.name: sendFile
methods.description: Send a file to this channel

params.name: attachment
params.description: The file to send

params.name: fileName
params.description: The name and extension of the file

params.name: content
params.description: Text message to send with the attachment

methods.description: Fetches the pinned messages of this Channel and returns a Collection of them.

methods.name: startTyping
methods.description: Starts a typing indicator in the channel.
examples:
// start typing in a channel
channel.startTyping();

params.name: count
params.description: The number of times startTyping should be considered to have been called

methods.name: stopTyping
methods.description:
Stops the typing indicator in the channel.
The indicator will only stop if this is called as many times as startTyping().
<info>It can take a few seconds for the Client User to stop typing.</info>
examples:
// stop typing in a channel
channel.stopTyping();

// force typing to fully stop in a channel
channel.stopTyping(true);

params.name: force
params.description: Whether or not to reset the call count and force the indicator to stop

classes.name: Guild
classes.description:
Represents a Guild (or a Server) on Discord.
<info>It's recommended to see if a guild is available before performing operations or reading data from it. You can
check this with `guild.available`.</info>

methods.name: edit
methods.description: Updates the Guild with new information - e.g. a new name.

params.name: data
params.description: The data to update the guild with

methods.name: setName
methods.description: Edit the name of the Guild.

params.name: name
params.description: The new name of the Guild

methods.name: setRegion
methods.description: Edit the region of the Guild.

params.name: region
params.description: The new region of the guild.

methods.name: setVerificationLevel
methods.description: Edit the verification level of the Guild.

params.name: verificationLevel
params.description: The new verification level of the guild

methods.name: setAFKChannel
methods.description: Edit the AFK channel of the Guild.

params.name: afkChannel
params.description: The new AFK channel

methods.name: setAFKTimeout
methods.description: Edit the AFK timeout of the Guild.

params.name: afkTimeout
params.description: The time in seconds that a user must be idle to be considered AFK

methods.name: setIcon
methods.description: Set a new Guild Icon.

params.name: icon
params.description: The new icon of the guild

methods.name: setOwner
methods.description: Sets a new owner of the Guild.

params.name: owner
params.description: The new owner of the Guild

methods.name: setSplash
methods.description: Set a new Guild Splash Logo.

params.name: splash
params.description: The new splash screen of the guild

methods.name: member
methods.description: Returns the GuildMember form of a User object, if the User is present in the guild.
examples:
// get the guild member of a user
const member = guild.member(message.author);

params.name: user
params.description: The user that you want to obtain the GuildMember of

methods.name: ban
methods.description: Bans a user from the guild.
examples:
// ban a user
guild.ban('123123123123');

params.name: user
params.description: The user to ban

params.name: deleteDays
params.description:
The amount of days worth of messages from this user that should
also be deleted. Between `0` and `7`.

methods.name: unban
methods.description: Unbans a user from the Guild.

params.name: user
params.description: The user to unban

methods.name: fetchBans
methods.description: Fetch a Collection of banned users in this Guild.

methods.name: fetchInvites
methods.description: Fetch a Collection of invites to this Guild. Resolves with a Collection mapping invites by their codes.

methods.name: fetchMember
methods.description: Fetch a single guild member from a user.

params.name: user
params.description: The user to fetch the member for

methods.name: fetchMembers
methods.description:
Fetches all the members in the Guild, even if they are offline. If the Guild has less than 250 members,
this should not be necessary.

params.name: query
params.description: An optional query to provide when fetching members

methods.name: createChannel
methods.description: Creates a new Channel in the Guild.

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the new channel

params.name: type
params.description: The type of the new channel, either `text` or `voice`

methods.name: createRole
methods.description: Creates a new role in the guild, and optionally updates it with the given information.
examples:
// create a new role with data
guild.createRole({ name: 'Super Cool People' })
  .then(role => console.log(`Created role ${role}`))
  .catch(console.log)

params.name: data
params.description: The data to update the role with

methods.name: leave
methods.description: Causes the Client to leave the guild.

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Causes the Client to delete the guild.

methods.name: sync
methods.description: Syncs this guild (already done automatically every 30 seconds). Only applicable to user accounts.

methods.name: equals
methods.description:
Whether this Guild equals another Guild. It compares all properties, so for most operations
it is advisable to just compare `guild.id === guild2.id` as it is much faster and is often
what most users need.

params.name: guild
params.description: The guild to compare

methods.name: toString
methods.description: When concatenated with a string, this automatically concatenates the Guild's name instead of the Guild object.
examples:
// logs: Hello from My Guild!
console.log(`Hello from ${guild}!`);

// logs: Hello from My Guild!
console.log(`Hello from ' + guild + '!');

properties.name: client
properties.description: The Client that created the instance of the the Guild.

properties.name: members
properties.description: A Collection of members that are in this Guild. The key is the member's ID, the value is the member.

properties.name: channels
properties.description: A Collection of channels that are in this Guild. The key is the channel's ID, the value is the channel.

properties.name: roles
properties.description: A Collection of roles that are in this Guild. The key is the role's ID, the value is the role.

properties.name: available
properties.description: Whether the Guild is available to access. If it is not available, it indicates a server outage.

properties.name: id
properties.description: The Unique ID of the Guild, useful for comparisons.

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name of the guild

properties.name: icon
properties.description: The hash of the guild icon, or null if there is no icon.

properties.name: splash
properties.description: The hash of the guild splash image, or null if no splash (VIP only)

properties.name: region
properties.description: The region the guild is located in

properties.name: memberCount
properties.description: The full amount of members in this Guild as of `READY`

properties.name: large
properties.description: Whether the guild is "large" (has more than 250 members)

properties.name: features
properties.description: An array of guild features.

properties.name: emojis
properties.description: An array of guild emojis.

properties.name: afkTimeout
properties.description: The time in seconds before a user is counted as "away from keyboard".

properties.name: afkChannelID
properties.description: The ID of the voice channel where AFK members are moved.

properties.name: embedEnabled
properties.description: Whether embedded images are enabled on this guild.

properties.name: verificationLevel
properties.description: The verification level of the guild.

properties.name: creationDate
properties.description: The time the guild was created

properties.name: joinDate
properties.description: The date at which the logged-in client joined the guild.

properties.name: iconURL
properties.description: Gets the URL to this guild's icon (if it has one, otherwise it returns null)

properties.name: owner
properties.description: The owner of the Guild

properties.name: defaultChannel
properties.description: The `#general` GuildChannel of the server.

classes.name: MessageCollector
classes.description: Collects messages based on a specified filter, then emits them.

params.name: channel
params.description: The channel to collect messages in

params.name: filter
params.description: The filter function

params.name: options
params.description: Options for the collector

methods.name: stop
methods.description: Stops the collector and emits `end`.

params.name: reason
params.description: An optional reason for stopping the collector

properties.name: channel
properties.description: The channel this collector is operating on

properties.name: filter
properties.description: A function used to filter messages that the collector collects.

properties.name: options
properties.description: Options for the collecor.

properties.name: ended
properties.description: Whether this collector has stopped collecting Messages.

properties.name: collected
properties.description: A collection of collected messages, mapped by message ID.

events.name: message
events.description: Emitted whenever the Collector receives a Message that passes the filter test.

params.name: message
params.description: The received message

params.name: collector
params.description: The collector the message passed through

events.name: end
events.description: Emitted when the Collector stops collecting.

params.name: collection
params.description:
A collection of messages collected
during the lifetime of the Collector, mapped by the ID of the Messages.

params.name: reason
params.description:
The reason for the end of the collector. If it ended because it reached the specified time
limit, this would be `time`. If you invoke `.stop()` without specifying a reason, this would be `user`. If it
ended because it reached its message limit, it will be `limit`.

params.description:
either a guild channel, user or a role object, or a string representing
the ID of any of these.

methods.name: pin
methods.description: Pins this message to the channel's pinned messages

methods.name: unpin
methods.description: Unpins this message from the channel's pinned messages

methods.name: equals
methods.description:
Used mainly internally. Whether two messages are identical in properties. If you want to compare messages
without checking all the properties, use `message.id === message2.id`, which is much more efficient. This
method allows you to see if there are differences in content, embeds, attachments, nonce and tts properties.

params.name: message
params.description: The message to compare it to

params.description: Raw data passed through the WebSocket about this message

properties.description: The client that instantiated the Message

properties.description: The channel that the message was sent in

properties.description: If the message was sent in a guild, this will be the guild the message was sent in

properties.name: id
properties.description: The ID of the message (unique in the channel it was sent)

properties.name: content
properties.description: The content of the message

properties.name: author
properties.description: The author of the message

properties.name: member
properties.description:
Represents the Author of the message as a Guild Member. Only available if the message comes from a Guild
where the author is still a member.

properties.name: pinned
properties.description: Whether or not this message is pinned

properties.name: tts
properties.description: Whether or not the message was Text-To-Speech

properties.name: nonce
properties.description: A random number used for checking message delivery

properties.name: system
properties.description: Whether or not this message was sent by Discord, not actually a user (e.g. pin notifications)

properties.name: embeds
properties.description: A list of embeds in the message - e.g. YouTube Player

properties.name: attachments
properties.description: A collection of attachments in the message - e.g. Pictures - mapped by their ID.

properties.name: mentions
properties.description: An object containing a further users, roles or channels collections

props.name: mentions.users
props.description: Mentioned users, maps their ID to the user object.

props.name: mentions.roles
props.description: Mentioned roles, maps their ID to the role object.

props.name: mentions.channels
props.description:
Mentioned channels,
maps their ID to the channel object.

properties.name: timestamp
properties.description: When the message was sent

properties.name: editedTimestamp
properties.description: If the message was edited, the timestamp at which it was last edited

properties.name: cleanContent
properties.description: The message contents with all mentions replaced by the equivalent text.

properties.name: edits
properties.description:
An array of cached versions of the message, including the current version.
Sorted from latest (first) to oldest (last).

typedefs.name: UserResolvable
typedefs.description:
Data that resolves to give a User object. This can be:
* A User object
* A User ID
* A Message (resolves to the message author)
* A Guild (owner of the guild)
* A Guild Member

typedefs.name: GuildResolvable
typedefs.description:
Data that resolves to give a Guild object. This can be:
* A Guild object

typedefs.name: GuildMemberResolvable
typedefs.description:
Data that resolves to give a GuildMember object. This can be:
* A GuildMember object
* A User object

typedefs.name: Base64Resolvable
typedefs.description:
Data that resolves to give a Base64 string, typically for image uploading. This can be:
* A Buffer
* A Base64 string

typedefs.name: ChannelResolvable
typedefs.description:
Data that can be resolved to give a Channel. This can be:
* An instance of a Channel
* An ID of a Channel

typedefs.name: PermissionResolvable
typedefs.description:
Data that can be resolved to give a permission number. This can be:
* A string
* A permission number

typedefs.name: StringResolvable
typedefs.description:
Data that can be resolved to give a string. This can be:
* A string
* An Array (joined with a new line delimiter to give a string)
* Any value

typedefs.name: FileResolvable
typedefs.description:
Data that can be resolved to give a Buffer. This can be:
* A Buffer
* The path to a local file
* A URL

typedefs.name: StreamOptions
PermissionOverwriteOptions
typedefs.description:
An object mapping permission flags to `true` (enabled) or `false` (disabled)
```js
{
 'SEND_MESSAGES': true,
 'ATTACH_FILES': false,
}
```

typedefs.name: InviteOptions
typedefs.description:
Options given when creating a Guild Channel Invite:
```js
{
 temporary: false, // whether the invite should kick users after 24hrs if they are not given a new role
 maxAge: 0, // the time in seconds the invite expires in
 maxUses: 0, // the maximum amount of uses for this invite
}
```

typedefs.name: MessageOptions
ChannelLogsQueryOptions
typedefs.description:
The parameters to pass in when requesting previous messages from a channel. `around`, `before` and
`after` are mutually exclusive. All the parameters are optional.
```js
{
 limit: 30, // the message limit, defaults to 50
 before: '123', // gets messages before the given message ID
 after: '123', // gets messages after the given message ID
 around: '123', // gets messages around the given message ID
}
```

typedefs.name: AwaitMessagesOptions
CollectorFilterFunction
CollectorOptions
typedefs.description:
An object containing options used to configure a MessageCollector. All properties are optional.
```js
{
 time: null, // time in milliseconds. If specified, the collector ends after this amount of time.
 max: null, // the maximum amount of messages to handle before ending.
}
```

typedefs.name: ClientOptions
typedefs.description:
Options that can be passed to a client:
```js
{
  ws: {
    large_threshold: 250,
    compress: true,
    properties: {
      $os: process ? process.platform : 'discord.js',
      $browser: 'discord.js',
      $device: 'discord.js',
      $referrer: '',
      $referring_domain: '',
    },
  },
  protocol_version: 6,
  max_message_cache: 200,
  rest_ws_bridge_timeout: 5000,
  api_request_method: 'sequential',
  shard_id: 0,
  shard_count: 0,
  fetch_all_members: false,
  disable_everyone: false,
};
```

general.name: Welcome
general.data: [![Discord](https://discordapp.com/api/guilds/222078108977594368/embed.png)](https://discord.gg/bRCvFy9) [![npm](https://img.shields.io/npm/v/discord.js.svg?maxAge=2592000)](https://www.npmjs.com/package/discord.js) [![npm](https://img.shields.io/npm/dt/discord.js.svg?maxAge=2592000)](https://www.npmjs.com/package/discord.js) [![Build Status](https://travis-ci.org/hydrabolt/discord.js.svg)](https://travis-ci.org/hydrabolt/discord.js) [![David](https://img.shields.io/david/hydrabolt/discord.js.svg?maxAge=2592000)](https://david-dm.org/hydrabolt/discord.js) [![NPM](https://nodei.co/npm/discord.js.png?downloads=true&stars=true)](https://nodei.co/npm/discord.js/) discord.js is a powerful node.js module that allows you to interact with the [Discord API](https://discordapp.com/developers/docs/intro). # Welcome! Welcome to the discord.js v9 documentation. The v9 rewrite has taken a lot of time, but it should be much more stable and performant than previous versions. ## Installation **Node.js 6.0.0 or newer is required.** With voice support: `npm install --save discord.js --production` Without voice support: `npm install --save discord.js --production --no-optional` By default, discord.js uses [opusscript](https://www.npmjs.com/package/opusscript) when playing audio over voice connections. If you're looking to play over multiple voice connections, it might be better to install [node-opus](https://www.npmjs.com/package/node-opus). discord.js will automatically prefer node-opus over opusscript. ## Guides * [LuckyEvie's general guide](https://eslachance.gitbooks.io/discord-js-bot-guide/content/) * [York's v9 upgrade guide](https://yorkaargh.wordpress.com/2016/09/03/updating-discord-js-bots/) ## Links * [Website](http://hydrabolt.github.io/discord.js/) * [Discord Server](https://discord.gg/bRCvFy9) * [Documentation](http://hydrabolt.github.io/discord.js/#!/docs/tag/master) * [Legacy Documentation](http://discordjs.readthedocs.io/en/8.1.0/docs_client.html) * [GitHub](https://github.com/hydrabolt/discord.js) * [NPM](https://www.npmjs.com/package/discord.js) * [Examples](https://github.com/hydrabolt/discord.js/tree/master/docs/custom/examples) * [Related Libraries](https://discordapi.com/unofficial/libs.html) ## Help If you don't understand something in this documentation, you are experiencing problems, or you just need a gentle nudge in the right direction, please don't hesitate to join our official [Discord.js Server](https://discord.gg/bRCvFy9).

general.name: Updating your code
general.data:
# About Version 9
The version 9 (v9) rewrite takes a much more object-oriented approach than previous versions,
which allows your code to be much more readable and manageable.
It's been rebuilt from the ground up and should be much more stable, fixing caching issues that affected
older versions. It also has support for newer Discord Features, such as emojis.

## Upgrading your code
Version 9, while containing a sizable number of breaking changes, does not require much change in your code's logic -
most of the concepts are still the same, but loads of functions have been moved around.
The vast majority of methods you're used to using have been moved out of the Client class,
into other more relevant classes where they belong.
Because of this, you will need to convert most of your calls over to the new methods.

Here are a few examples of methods that have changed:
* `Client.sendMessage(channel, message)` ==> `TextChannel.sendMessage(message)`
  * `Client.sendMessage(user, message)` ==> `User.sendMessage(message)`
* `Client.updateMessage(message, "New content")` ==> `Message.edit("New Content")`
* `Client.getChannelLogs(channel, limit)` ==> `TextChannel.fetchMessages({options})`
* `Server.detailsOfUser(User)` ==> `Server.members.get(User).properties` (retrieving a member gives a GuildMember object)
* `Client.joinVoiceChannel(voicechannel)` => `VoiceChannel.join()`

A couple more important details:
* `Client.loginWithToken("token")` ==> `client.login("token")`
* `Client.servers.length` ==> `client.guilds.size` (all instances of `server` are now `guild`)

## Callbacks
Version 9 eschews callbacks in favour of Promises. This means all code relying on callbacks must be changed.  
For example, the following code:

```js
client.getChannelLogs(channel, 100, function(messages) {
  console.log(`${messages.length} messages found`);
});
```

```js
channel.fetchMessages({limit: 100}).then(messages => {
  console.log(`${messages.size} messages found`);
});
```
